      <T> void prepareMerge(SQLStatement stat, java.lang.String schemaName, java.lang.String tableName, TableDefinition<T> def, java.lang.Object obj)
      PostgreSQL and Derby do not support the SQL2003 MERGE syntax, but we can use a trick to insert a row if it does not exist and call update() in Db.merge() if the affected row count is 0.

      • prepareMerge

        public <T> void prepareMerge(SQLStatement stat,
                    java.lang.String schemaName,
                    java.lang.String tableName,
                    TableDefinition<T> def,
                    java.lang.Object obj)
        Description copied from class: SQLDialectDefault
        PostgreSQL and Derby do not support the SQL2003 MERGE syntax, but we can use a trick to insert a row if it does not exist and call update() in Db.merge() if the affected row count is 0.

        Databases that do support a MERGE syntax should override this method.

        http://stackoverflow.com/questions/407688

        Specified by:
        prepareMerge in interface SQLDialect
        Overrides:
        prepareMerge in class SQLDialectDefault
        Parameters:
        stat - return the SQL statement
        schemaName - the schema name
        tableName - the table name
        def - the table definition
        obj - values
